title: Sydney's luxe new resort is at the zoo
text:
Sighting a koala and a kangaroo - along with the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House have long rated top of the wish list for those visiting Australia.

Given a record 9.3 million visitors flooded into the country from overseas in financial 2019, that's a lot of people needing to clap eyes on our top tourist hits.

When it was announced in 2017, the project split Mosman Council, with many opposed to the idea. Getty

In a stroke of strategy genius, Taronga Zoo has found a way to help tourists do it in style and all in the one hit - albeit they'll want to be relatively well-heeled with prices starting at $790 a night for two people to experience Sydney's top four.

On Thursday, following a two-year build program, the zoo unveiled its $44.5 million Wildlife Retreat, comprising 62 rooms built across five environmentally sensitive lodges - with many of the rooms offering both zoo and gun-barrel harbour views.

There's also a lodge "nest" or clubhouse for drinks and canapes, as well as a fine dining restaurant, with both facilities only available to retreat guests and boasting among the best views in Sydney.
description: Taronga Zoo's 62 environmentally sensitive, luxury rooms are destined to be a hit with locals and tourists alike. Not least thanks to the view.
